page.title: 08A E Housman
page.content: A E Housman was a famous poet who lived in this area. Thomas Housman was the first vicar of Catshill Church. He had a son, Edward,who married Sarah in 1858. Their first boy was christened Alfred Edward at Catshill Church in 1859 by his grandad. They lived at Valley House,Valley Road,before moving to Perry Hall Kidderminster Road, Bromsgrove where they had 6 children & planted 7 chestnut trees in the garden. They moved to Clock House, Valley Road. Alfred went to St John's College,Oxford. He became Kennedy Prof of Latin at Trinity College,Cambridge. All the Housmans were buried in Catshill churchyard & the chestnut trees moved there. A E Housman's ashes were buried in Ludlow where he lived in later life. He died in 1936. A Housman Society was begun in 1970s & a bronze statue the High St, Bromsgrove.
